str2: For. A primary particle; properly, assigning a reason.
(including the other inflections); from toi and houtos; truly this, i.e. Of this sort (to denote character or individuality).
No, not. Also ouk, and ouch a primary word; the absolute negative adverb; no or not.

parse: Verb - Present Indicative Active - 3rd Person Plural
str2: To be a slave, be subject to, obey, be devoted. From doulos; to be a slave to.

parse: Personal / Possessive Pronoun - Genitive 1st Person Plural
str2: I, the first-person pronoun. A primary pronoun of the first person I.
Lord, master, sir; the Lord. From kuros; supreme in authority, i.e. controller; by implication, Master.
Anointed One; the Messiah, the Christ. From chrio; Anointed One, i.e. The Messiah, an epithet of Jesus.
But, except, however. Neuter plural of allos; properly, other things, i.e. contrariwise.

parse: Reflexive Pronoun - Genitive Masculine 3rd Person Plural
str2: Himself, herself, itself.
The, the definite article. Including the feminine he, and the neuter to in all their inflections; the definite article; the.
From koilos; a cavity, i.e. the abdomen; by implication, the matrix; figuratively, the heart.
A primary preposition denoting the channel of an act; through.
A kind address; in a bad sense: plausible speaking. From a compound of chrestos and lego; fair speech, i.e. Plausibility.
And, even, also, namely.
Adulation, praise, blessing, gift.

parse: Verb - Present Indicative Active - 3rd Person Plural
str2: To deceive thoroughly. From ek and apatao; to seduce wholly.
The, the definite article. Including the feminine he, and the neuter to in all their inflections; the definite article; the.
Prolonged from a primary kar; the heart, i.e. the thoughts or feelings; also the middle.
The, the definite article. Including the feminine he, and the neuter to in all their inflections; the definite article; the.
Innocent, guileless, simple. Not bad, i.e. innocent or unsuspecting.
